results.title: Nests in the bush
results.brief_description: A classroom film for young children on how different Australian birds build and conceal their nests and rear their young. Yellow robin, wren, loterill, honey-eater and wagtail are among those seen.
results.description: A classroom film for young children on how different Australian birds build and conceal their nests and rear their young. Yellow robin, wren, loterill, honey-eater and wagtail are among those seen.

results.title: News digest [No. 9]
results.creator_credit: ABC and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Kyabram’s rodeo; 12,000 sea shells collected from the world’s beaches; Victoria’s first mobile water patrol equipped with a bar tender cruiser is launched at Sandringham; underwater enthusiasts collect relics from old steamers; movies on the move at the Myer Music Bowl shown by the State Film Centre on a 24 by 8 foot screen as part of the Moomba festivities.

results.title: Farewell to charms
results.creator_credit: Carla Pontiac, Carole Sklan and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: An experimental feminist film which questions the goals of love and romance as a woman’s ultimate fulfillment. Emma, vivacious but suicidal terrorist is reunited with Cecily, her old school chum. They meet a ‘bionic bike dyke’ called stretch and break open the jelly beans. Will they stretch a point over the pool table? Will tap-dancing and vaginal exercises be enough for Cecily? Will Emma metamorphose into Esther Williams? True romance. Cast includes Radda Jordan, Helen Pankhurst.

results.title: Bread and dripping
results.creator_credit: Women's Film Collective, Margot Nash and Wimins Films
results.brief_description: The role of the women during the Great Depression has often been neglected in the telling of Australian history. Using archival footage, this film illustrates the hardships and the political struggles women faced in a time of political and economic upheaval.

results.title: Age before beauty
results.creator_credit: Sarah Gibson, Susan Lambert and Sydney Filmmakers Co-operative
results.brief_description: Shows older women involved in a variety of activities including exercise classes and dances. Shows them undertaking “alternative” health treatments such as chiropractry and acupuncture. Exposes the negative stereotyping of older women and investigates women’s fear of the aging process.

results.title: Red Matildas
results.creator_credit: Sharon Connolly, Trevor Graham and Yarra Bank Films
results.brief_description: Through the lives of three women, Audrey Blake, May Pennefather and Joan Goodwin, “Red Matildas” explores the social and political conditions in Australia during the Great Depression - conditions of massive unemployment, widespread malnutrition and growing militarism at home and abroad, that provoked many people to political activity. May Pennefather served 12-18 months in the Spanish Civil War. Cinematographer: Laurie McInnes

May Pennefather served 12-18 months in the Spanish Civil War. Cinematographer: Laurie McInnes

results.title: Autograph
results.brief_description: One of 6 works selected by AIM director David Atkinson as representing the best interactive work produced by the AIM centre up until 2004. An interactive work focusing on the use of eloquent graphics and innovative interface screen design for navigation. The work deals with themes such as humanity, organics and technology. A beautiful work pioneering elegant design with an innovative interface. Invited for exhibition at the Young Talent Pavilion in MILIA, France in 1995.

results.title: Anzac
results.creator_credit: Jennie Blackwood, Adrian Boddington and Zanthus Films
results.brief_description: Historical photographs and early newsreels tell the story of the Gallipoli assault; embarkation and transport of 75,000 men in 200 ships from Egypt to Gallipoli; initial landing below cliffs; building a jetty and digging in; main British attack at Cape Helles and subsequent assaults on the heights; hardships, casualties and final evacuation. Commentary by Moray Powell and Peter Carver.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jennie Blackwood, Adrian Boddington and Zanthus Films
results.description: Historical photographs and early newsreels tell the story of the Gallipoli assault; embarkation and transport of 75,000 men in 200 ships from Egypt to Gallipoli; initial landing below cliffs; building a jetty and digging in; main British attack at Cape Helles and subsequent assaults on the heights; hardships, casualties and final evacuation. Commentary by Moray Powell and Peter Carver.

results.title: Children's Theatre
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, John Morris, Lilias Fraser and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Children at the Studio Theatre in Adelaide study painting, music and speech as part of their training in ballet. This is a Children’s Theatre for children and by children. Classes and rehearsals, planning and teaching precede the performance of an Australian ballet, telling the story of an Australian aboriginal legend.
